required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Anlotinib Combined With Nivolumab for Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: The Efficacy and Safety of Anlotinib Combined With Nivolumab as a Second-Line Treatment in Patients With Advanced Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer

lead_sponsor.agency: The First Affiliated Hospital with Nanjing Medical University

clinical_study.source: The First Affiliated Hospital with Nanjing Medical University

brief_summary.textblock: This study evaluates the safety and efficacy of anlotinib in combination with nivilumab as second-line treatment in advanced NSCLC patients. The primary endpoint of the study is progression-free survival (PFS);the secondary endpoints are disease control rate (DCR), objective response rate (ORR), overall survival (OS) and safety.

primary_outcome.description: PFS is defined as the time from the date of treatment to the first date of disease progression or death from any cause.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: each 42 days up to intolerance the toxicity or PD (up to 12 months)
secondary_outcome.description: Treatment response are defined as complete response (CR), partial response (PR), stable disease (SD) and progression disease (PD) according to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumor (RECISIT criteria, version 1.1). The percentage of patients who achieved CR and PR was defined as objective response rate (ORR)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: each 42 days up to intolerance the toxicity or PD (up to 12 months)
secondary_outcome.description: Treatment response are defined as complete response (CR), partial response (PR), stable disease (SD) and progression disease (PD) according to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumor (RECISIT criteria, version 1.1) and the percentage of patients who achieved CR, PR and SD was defined as disease control rate (DCR).
OS is calculated from diagnosis to death or last follow-up time.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants with Adverse Events as a Measure of Safety and Tolerability

intervention.description: Anlotinib will be given at a dose of 12mg once daily on days 1-14 of a 21-day cycle.
Nivolumab will be given at a dose of 240 mg every 2 weeks (Odd Cycles: Days 1 and 15 and Even Cycles Day 8) per 21 day Cycle.
